channel.title: Open an image with size relative to screen size
channel.description:
So I'm making my professional web site, and I'm going to have all my work on it.
Videos, easy.
Images. A task.
Basically, I'm going to have thumbnails on the right side, and when you click one it'll bring that image to the body section. But I want the images more hi-res than that. So after making it move to the body section and be bigger, I'm also having the option to click it to open a new window with the full res image in that.
So after you click the bigger image it does the lightbox kinda thing where it opens it with javascript.
But here's a question. People have different screen sizes. The images will be quite big, ranging from 1280x720 to 1900x1080. If someone has a small resolution, I don't want to open that full res image all the way. I'd like it to open to it's size, unless it's size is larger or equal to their current resolution. If it is larger or equal to, then only open the image to 80% of their browser window or screen.
How hard would it be to make that image popup size relative to their size? I know I can use percentages instead of pixels.
The problem with that is if the image is smaller than their resolution, it enlarges it. And I don't know how I'd do that with javascript or CSS.
I know a bit of HTML and CSS, but the only javascript I know is looking through Lightbox.
